API Reference¶

This is the class and function reference of pysal.

pysal.explore: Exploratory spatial data analysis¶

pysal.explore.esda: Spatial Autocorrelation Analysis¶

Gamma Statistic¶

pysal.explore.esda.Gamma(y, w[, operation, …]) Gamma index for spatial autocorrelation

Geary Statistic¶

pysal.explore.esda.Geary(y, w[, …]) Global Geary C Autocorrelation statistic

Getis-Ord Statistics¶

pysal.explore.esda.G(y, w[, permutations]) Global G Autocorrelation Statistic
pysal.explore.esda.G_Local(y, w[, …]) Generalized Local G Autocorrelation

Join Count Statistics¶

pysal.explore.esda.Join_Counts(y, w[, …]) Binary Join Counts

Moran Statistics¶

pysal.explore.esda.Moran(y, w[, …]) Moran’s I Global Autocorrelation Statistic
pysal.explore.esda.Moran_BV(x, y, w[, …]) Bivariate Moran’s I
pysal.explore.esda.Moran_BV_matrix(variables, w) Bivariate Moran Matrix
pysal.explore.esda.Moran_Local(y, w[, …]) Local Moran Statistics
pysal.explore.esda.Moran_Local_BV(x, y, w[, …]) Bivariate Local Moran Statistics
pysal.explore.esda.Moran_Rate(e, b, w[, …]) Adjusted Moran’s I Global Autocorrelation Statistic for Rate Variables [Assun_o_1999]
pysal.explore.esda.Moran_Local_Rate(e, b, w) Adjusted Local Moran Statistics for Rate Variables [Assuncao1999]

pysal.explore.giddy: Geospatial Distribution Dynamics¶

Markov Methods¶

pysal.explore.giddy.markov.Markov(class_ids) Classic Markov transition matrices.
pysal.explore.giddy.markov.Spatial_Markov(y, w) Markov transitions conditioned on the value of the spatial lag.
pysal.explore.giddy.markov.LISA_Markov(y, w) Markov for Local Indicators of Spatial Association
pysal.explore.giddy.markov.kullback(F) Kullback information based test of Markov Homogeneity.
pysal.explore.giddy.markov.prais(pmat) Prais conditional mobility measure.
pysal.explore.giddy.markov.homogeneity(…) Test for homogeneity of Markov transition probabilities across regimes.
pysal.explore.giddy.ergodic.steady_state(P) Calculates the steady state probability vector for a regular Markov transition matrix P.
pysal.explore.giddy.ergodic.fmpt(P) Calculates the matrix of first mean passage times for an ergodic transition probability matrix.
pysal.explore.giddy.ergodic.var_fmpt(P) Variances of first mean passage times for an ergodic transition probability matrix.

Directional LISA¶

pysal.explore.giddy.directional.Rose(Y, w[, k]) Rose diagram based inference for directional LISAs.

Economic Mobility Indices¶

pysal.explore.giddy.mobility.markov_mobility(p) Markov-based mobility index.

Exchange Mobility Methods¶

pysal.explore.giddy.rank.Theta(y, regime[, …]) Regime mobility measure.
pysal.explore.giddy.rank.Tau(x, y) Kendall’s Tau is based on a comparison of the number of pairs of n observations that have concordant ranks between two variables.
pysal.explore.giddy.rank.SpatialTau(x, y, w) Spatial version of Kendall’s rank correlation statistic.
pysal.explore.giddy.rank.Tau_Local(x, y) Local version of the classic Tau.
pysal.explore.giddy.rank.Tau_Local_Neighbor(x, y, w) Neighbor set LIMA.
pysal.explore.giddy.rank.Tau_Local_Neighborhood(x, y, w) Neighborhood set LIMA.
pysal.explore.giddy.rank.Tau_Regional(x, y, …) Inter and intraregional decomposition of the classic Tau.

pysal.explore.spaghetti:¶

spaghetti.Network¶

Network([in_data, node_sig, unique_segs, …]) Spatially-constrained network representation and analytical functionality.
Network.extractgraph() Using the existing network representation, create a graph-theoretic representation by removing all nodes with a neighbor incidence of two (non-articulation points).
Network.contiguityweights([graph, weightings]) Create a contiguity based W object.
Network.distancebandweights(threshold[, …]) Create distance based weights.
Network.snapobservations(in_data, name[, …]) Snap a point pattern shapefile to this network object.
Network.compute_distance_to_nodes(x, y, edge) Given an observation on a network edge, return the distance to the two nodes that bound that end.
Network.compute_snap_dist(pattern, idx) Given an observation snapped to a network edge, calculate the distance from the original location to the snapped location.
Network.count_per_edge(obs_on_network[, graph]) Compute the counts per edge.
Network.simulate_observations(count[, …]) Generate a simulated point pattern on the network.
Network.enum_links_node(v0) Returns the edges (links) around node.
Network.node_distance_matrix(n_processes[, …]) Called from within allneighbordistances(), nearestneighbordistances(), and distancebandweights().
Network.allneighbordistances(sourcepattern) Compute either all distances between i and j in a single point pattern or all distances between each i from a source pattern and all j from a destination pattern.
Network.nearestneighbordistances(sourcepattern) Compute the interpattern nearest neighbor distances or the intrapattern nearest neighbor distances between a source pattern and a destination pattern.
Network.NetworkF(pointpattern[, nsteps, …]) Computes a network constrained F-Function
Network.NetworkG(pointpattern[, nsteps, …]) Computes a network constrained G-Function
Network.NetworkK(pointpattern[, nsteps, …]) Computes a network constrained K-Function
Network.segment_edges(distance) Segment all of the edges in the network at either a
Network.savenetwork(filename) Save a network to disk as a binary file.
Network.loadnetwork(filename) Load a network from a binary file saved on disk.

spaghetti.NetworkBase¶

NetworkBase(ntw, pointpattern[, nsteps, …]) Base object for performing network analysis on a spaghetti.Network object.
NetworkBase.computeenvelope() compute upper and lower bounds of envelope
NetworkBase.setbounds(nearest) set upper and lower bounds
NetworkBase.validatedistribution() enusure statistical distribution is supported

spaghetti.NetworkF¶

NetworkF(ntw, pointpattern[, nsteps, …]) Compute a network constrained F statistic.
NetworkF.computeenvelope() compute upper and lower bounds of envelope
NetworkF.setbounds(nearest) set upper and lower bounds
NetworkF.validatedistribution() enusure statistical distribution is supported
NetworkF.computeobserved() compute the observed nearest and simulated nearest
NetworkF.computepermutations() compute permutations of the nearest

spaghetti.NetworkG¶

NetworkG(ntw, pointpattern[, nsteps, …]) Compute a network constrained G statistic.
NetworkG.computeenvelope() compute upper and lower bounds of envelope
NetworkG.setbounds(nearest) set upper and lower bounds
NetworkG.validatedistribution() enusure statistical distribution is supported
NetworkG.computeobserved() compute the observed nearest
NetworkG.computepermutations() compute permutations of the nearest

spaghetti.NetworkK¶

NetworkK(ntw, pointpattern[, nsteps, …]) Compute a network constrained K statistic.
NetworkK.computeenvelope() compute upper and lower bounds of envelope
NetworkK.setbounds(nearest) set upper and lower bounds
NetworkK.validatedistribution() enusure statistical distribution is supported
NetworkK.computeobserved() compute the observed nearest
NetworkK.computepermutations() compute permutations of the nearest

spaghetti.PointPattern¶

PointPattern([in_data, idvariable, attribute]) A stub point pattern class used to store a point pattern.

spaghetti.SimulatedPointPattern¶

SimulatedPointPattern() Struct style class to mirror the Point Pattern Class.

spaghetti¶

spaghetti.compute_length
spaghetti.dijkstra
spaghetti.dijkstra_mp
spaghetti.generatetree
spaghetti.get_neighbor_distances

pysal.viz: Geovisualization¶

pysal.explore.pysal.viz.mapclassify: Choropleth map classification¶

Classifiers¶

pysal.viz.mapclassify.Box_Plot(y[, hinge]) Box_Plot Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Equal_Interval(y[, k]) Equal Interval Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Fisher_Jenks(y[, k]) Fisher Jenks optimal classifier - mean based
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Fisher_Jenks_Sampled(y) Fisher Jenks optimal classifier - mean based using random sample
pysal.viz.mapclassify.HeadTail_Breaks(y) Head/tail Breaks Map Classification for Heavy-tailed Distributions
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Jenks_Caspall(y[, k]) Jenks Caspall Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Jenks_Caspall_Forced(y) Jenks Caspall Map Classification with forced movements
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Jenks_Caspall_Sampled(y) Jenks Caspall Map Classification using a random sample
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Max_P_Classifier(y[, …]) Max_P Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Maximum_Breaks(y[, k, …]) Maximum Breaks Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Natural_Breaks(y[, k, …]) Natural Breaks Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Quantiles(y[, k]) Quantile Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Percentiles(y[, pct]) Percentiles Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.Std_Mean(y[, multiples]) Standard Deviation and Mean Map Classification
pysal.viz.mapclassify.User_Defined(y, bins) User Specified Binning

Utilities¶

pysal.viz.mapclassify.K_classifiers(y[, pct]) Evaluate all k-classifers and pick optimal based on k and GADF
pysal.viz.mapclassify.gadf(y[, method, …]) Evaluate the Goodness of Absolute Deviation Fit of a Classifier Finds the minimum value of k for which gadf>pct
